metadata.synopsis: Dialog with the Gur Leader after you defeated Cazador
metadata.how_to_trigger: Origin Debug Book (Ctrl+Shift+7)Astarion - Origin Moments - Gur Follow-upWalk towards the Gur Leader

5.speaker: Ulma
5.text: You killed not only Cazador, but also his wretched creations. I expected less.

80.speaker: Astarion
80.text: So I can see from all your heavily-armed friends. You didn't think I could resist completing the ritual, did you?

64.speaker: Ulma
64.text: I admit, I had my doubts. I did not want to face a new, powerful vampire unarmed. I am pleased to be wrong.

42.speaker: Astarion
42.text: Thank you. And for what it's worth - I'm sorry. I wish I could return the ones I took from you.

24.speaker: Ulma
24.text: I had hoped to avoid this path. I had hoped you would choose the better road.

58.speaker: Ulma
58.text: A fool I was, to ever hope a beast like you could be saved.

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: Oh please, there's no need for such language. I promised you Cazador's death and I more than delivered.

50.speaker: Ulma
50.text: Cazador is destroyed and his plans ruined. I was not sure you could do it.

79.speaker: Astarion
79.text: Cazador may be gone, but there are still thousands of vampire spawn down there.

70.speaker: Ulma
70.text: An unexpected wrinkle, but we shall tend to them. You have done enough.

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: Cazador may be gone, but there are still thousands of vampire spawn down there. Including your children.

91.speaker: Astarion
91.text: Out of my way. I'm in no mood to talk.

89.speaker: Ulma
89.text: Slaying Cazador was a great justice. You have our thanks, now and forever.

67.speaker: Ulma
67.text: You killed one vampire, but released seven thousand of his spawn? Have you lost all sense?

63.speaker: Astarion
63.text: They were innocents. To kill them would have been an even greater crime.

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: But if you ever decide to hunt them, know they include your children.

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: That depends on how you define 'survived', really, but they are free. They're making their way into the Underdark as we speak.

103.speaker: Ulma
103.text: This is... difficult news. We will need to decide what it means.

72.speaker: Ulma
72.text: Perhaps, but innocent or not, they remain dangerous.

82.speaker: Ulma
82.text: Thank you for what you have done - slaying Cazador was a great justice. As for the rest... well, time will tell.

74.speaker: Ulma
74.text: Hold there, vampire. We have business to settle.

87.speaker: Narrator
87.text: *You don't know the woman's name, but you recognise her face. You saw it in the firelight, twisted in rage and grief the night you stole her tribe's children.*

52.speaker: Ulma
52.text: I am Ulma, of the Gur. You know my people. You helped your master bring us down.

99.speaker: Astarion
99.text: And your children helped me ascend to new power. How fitting.

34.speaker: Astarion
34.text: I'm sorry I took your children, but Cazador's dead now. It's over.

12.speaker: Ulma
12.text: For you, perhaps. Not for us.

105.speaker: Ulma
105.text: We searched for you when we heard you were free, hoping you could help us undo the evil he started.

14.speaker: Ulma
14.text: We tracked you halfway across the Sword Coast, only to finally catch up with you here.

86.speaker: Ulma
86.text: One blood-sucking beast replaced with another. Our children sacrificed to birth a monster.

38.speaker: Astarion
38.text: I had no choice, I was a spawn, following orders.

49.speaker: Ulma
49.text: Once, perhaps. Now you're something else entirely.

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: If you want to fight, can we just get on with it?

95.speaker: Ulma
95.text: I did not come here to fight. I'd hoped to talk.

83.speaker: Ulma
83.text: You killed not only Cazador, but also his wretched creations. I admit, I expected less.

56.speaker: Ulma
56.text: For us, destroying evil is a simple choice. We are born to do it - trained to do it.

96.speaker: Ulma
96.text: But to face your kin? To face everything you know and still make that choice. There is nothing simple there.

26.speaker: Astarion
26.text: You didn't think I could do it? I'm hurt.

35.speaker: Ulma
35.text: I never doubted your ability to kill. But your ability to resist temptation? That I doubted.

16.speaker: Ulma
16.text: I feared you would complete the ritual and we would face a new, more powerful foe. I am pleased to be wrong.

3.speaker: Astarion
3.text: Well I expect you'll leave me in peace from now on.

76.speaker: Ulma
76.text: Your sins against us were great. But today, so were your deeds.

102.speaker: Ulma
102.text: You are free - never again will you be hunted by my people.

9.speaker: Astarion
9.text: Thank you, I only want to live in peace.

30.speaker: Ulma
30.text: I fear none of us will see peace yet. There are still trials ahead.

84.speaker: Ulma
84.text: But you have my people's thanks - when it is time for you to face those trials, we will stand with you.

90.speaker: Astarion
90.text: For what it's worth, I'm sorry. I wish I could bring your children back.

2.speaker: Ulma
2.text: You gave them peace. For that, for all you have done, you have our thanks.

53.speaker: Ulma
53.text: I know you face trials ahead. But when it is time, you will not face them alone. We will stand with you as best we can.

47.speaker: Ulma
47.text: We offer no gold, but we do give you a promise.

40.speaker: Astarion
40.text: And I hope I never see any of you again.

104.speaker: Ulma
104.text: I would not be so hasty. You have trials still to face - you may want allies.

22.speaker: Ulma
22.text: If such a time comes, if you need help, we will stand with you.

66.speaker: Ulma
66.text: Until then, go in peace. And thank you.

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: Get out of my way. I'm in no mood to talk.

55.speaker: Ulma
55.text: Forgive me, I meant no disrespect.

92.speaker: Ulma
92.text: Cazador is destroyed and his plans ruined. I was not sure you could do it.

20.speaker: Astarion
20.text: You should know - Cazador may be dead, but there are still thousands of spawn locked up down there.

107.speaker: Ulma
107.text: I had hoped to avoid this path. I had hoped you would choose the better road.

10.speaker: Ulma
10.text: A fool I was, to ever hope a beast like you could be saved.

77.speaker: Astarion
77.text: Don't you understand? With this power I can save the city!

46.speaker: Ulma
46.text: And when the city is saved? Can you give up this power? Or do you look for the next battle? The next conquest?

11.speaker: Ulma
11.text: Perhaps today your intentions are good? Perhaps. But power twists people. Corrupts people. Convinces them to do terrible things for a 'greater good'.

18.speaker: Ulma
18.text: We do not wait for that to happen. We destroy evil here, today!

94.speaker: Astarion
94.text: I promised I'd kill Cazador. Did I not deliver?

108.speaker: Ulma
108.text: You think we will see one evil replaced by another? No.

59.speaker: Astarion
59.text: Walk away. Don't sacrifice what's left of your tribe for nothing.

44.speaker: Ulma
44.text: If we turn our backs on evil like you, then my tribe is not worth saving.

45.speaker: Ulma
45.context: NodeContext: Over her shoulder to the warriors behind her - calling them to join her in attacking you

1.speaker: Astarion
1.text: You're even more of a fool to stand in my way now.

69.speaker: Ulma
69.text: Perhaps. But better a fool than a coward.

109.speaker: Ulma
109.text: You killed one vampire, but released seven thousand of his spawn? Have you lost all sense?

19.speaker: Astarion
19.text: They were innocent - it would have been more evil to kill them.

23.speaker: Ulma
23.text: Perhaps, but innocent or not, they remain dangerous.

65.speaker: Ulma
65.text: Thank you for what you have done - slaying Cazador was a great justice. As for the rest... well, time will tell.

112.speaker: Astarion
112.text: Yes, I set them free. Including your children - they're spawn too now.

68.speaker: Ulma
68.context: NodeContext: just got the terrible news her tribes children were turned into vampires

78.speaker: Ulma
78.text: This is... difficult news. We will need to decide what it means.

15.speaker: Astarion
15.text: They're in the Underdark - they'll feed on the monsters down there.

61.speaker: Ulma
61.text: I pray you are right. But if they leave to hunt on the surface, they will get no mercy from us.

88.speaker: Astarion
88.text: So? If you have a problem with it, go deal with it.

93.speaker: Ulma
93.text: Do not fear, they will be dealt with.
